revised_title: Anatomical Investigation of the Mesencephalic Nucleus of the Fifth Nerve in Selachian Brain
tldr: The authors conducted an anatomical investigation of the mesencephalic nucleus of the fifth nerve in the selachian brain, focusing on the dogfish, skate, and rays. They discovered the nucleus contains 800-1100 cells distributed about the midline at the ventral surface of the optic tectum. The study provides a description of cellular form, cell distribution, and the principal connections of the nucleus, which is essential for understanding the evolution of this pathway within the vertebrate central nervous system.
